creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons, in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Three panel huipil with round-cut neck opening and randas; embroidered pansies  and birds in orange, blue, red, green circle neck opening (possibly applied to garment); white openweave ground with supplementary patterning in purple, violet, and yellow; pattern consists of bands of varying widths of 'bird in tree' figures, human figures, flower in vase motif and other geometric forms.
object_name: Woman's blouse (Huipil) used as Wedding veil
title: Woman's blouse (Huipil) used as Wedding veil
